Two crew members are stranded on a spacecraft and quickly - and horrifically - realize they are not alone. Two astronauts awaken in a hyper-sleep chamber aboard a seemingly abandoned spacecraft. It's pitch black, they are disoriented, and the only sound is a low rumble and creak from the belly of the ship. They can't remember anything: Who are they? What is their mission? With Lt. Payton staying behind to guide him via radio transmitter, Cpl. Bower ventures deep into the ship and begins to uncover a terrifying reality. Slowly the spacecraft's shocking, deadly secrets are revealed...and the astronauts find their own survival is more important than they could ever have imagined.

Crimacabre....NO R5  DOESN't mean its a DVDrip at all. R-stands for region code and the 5 designates it originated in either Russia or somewhere in Africa. If i was in Russia, any DVD i purchase is region coded R5. This info is give to us because many DVD players won't play DVD's that are NOT from there own region.   My point is just because It came from Russia, or is "R5" this is not a reflection of its quality... I SWEAR in my life this is true. Rather then argue this FACT.... If you think your right, I DARE you to goto the address below and read up on this FACT:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:DVD-Regions_with_key-2.svg

The subs really suck though.
The best English subs are 'DoNE' but aren't synced with the IMAGINE version of the film.
Best solution if you need the English subs and are not hearing impaired: Download the FXG version of the film but dump the subs since they're for the hearing impaired. Get the DoNE subs in English from either opensubtitles.org or moviesubtitles.org. No sync required.
